turns.content: How does a limousine's suspension system differ from that of a standard passenger car?

As an AI language model, I do not have personal experience or subjective opinions. However, I can provide the following information:

A limousine's suspension system is typically designed to support the additional weight and length of the vehicle compared to a standard passenger car. This is accomplished through the use of heavy-duty springs and shock absorbers, as well as other specialized components.

Additionally, limousines often have air suspension systems that allow the vehicle to be raised or lowered for easier entry and exit, as well as improved ride comfort. Some of the other features that may be found in a limousine's suspension system include adjustable dampers, electronic control systems, and special sway bars or stabilizers to help reduce body roll.

Overall, a limousine's suspension system is typically more robust and sophisticated than that of a standard passenger car, in order to provide a smoother and more comfortable ride for passengers.
